ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The class is focused around 4-5 major units with 4 major papers. I would highly recommend this course to any student wishing to improve their writing drastically.
The course is recommended for students who needa solid introduction to college-style academic writing. It prepares you for the bulk of writing (especially in the humanities) for the next few years.
English 114 02 was primarily a writing course themed with revolutions. I would certainly recommend this class to another student who is looking to improve his/her writing and critical reading skills.

Yes, I recommend this class if you feel like you need to get a better feel for writing standard college-level essays. Jordan is super cool and I think the class is helpful in easing you into the art of writing college papers.That said, class was a little unstructured, which didn't bother me but it may bother some. Also, little time was devoted in class to honing writing skills- you do some writing exercises, but most class time was devoted to open-ended discussion of various readings. Although I enjoyed the class and the discussion, the readings often seemed fairly random and disconnected from one another.

Revolutions is a class that will challenge and broaden your personal definition of "What is a revolution?" I totally recommend this class to all students. Argumentative writing is different from literary analyses or personal essays. This class will teach you how to form a solid literary argument.
